</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;537a8505.1503">   <title>One day workshop on Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;537a8505.1503</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>As part of the European Crystallography Meeting (http://ecm29.ecanews.org/&lt;http://ecm29.ecanews.org/programme/satellite-meetings/&gt;) there will be a one day satellite meeting on Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN.<br><br>Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN<br><br>Organizers: Diamond Light Source &amp; Croatian Association of Crystallographers<br><br>When? August 23rd, 2015 (Sunday), 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T11:35:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alun Ashton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;537a8505.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ff8bd688.1412">   <title>Re: Open .fio files and "refresh/update" button </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ff8bd688.1412</link>   <description> I will let other give technical details, shouldn't be a problem if size is reasonable! If helpful (within reason) we are happy to help to create show and tell videos as well.<br><br>Alun    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T13:37:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alun Ashton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ff8bd688.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;8c9878f2.1412">   <title>Re: Open .fio files and "refresh/update" button </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;8c9878f2.1412</link>   <description> On Thu, 11 Dec 2014, Alun Ashton wrote:<br><br>&gt; Thanks Gero,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I can confirm that the other thread is in jira.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Poorly formatted/incomplete data files are indeed an issue, one<br>&gt; possibility to allow the user to 'confirm things are working' is to make<br>&gt; examples available either in the distribution or we could possibly put<br>&gt; some on the website. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T14:32:08+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;8c9878f2.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;deeb78cf.1412">   <title>Re: Open .fio files and "refresh/update" button </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;deeb78cf.1412</link>   <description> Thanks Gero,<br><br>I can confirm that the other thread is in jira.<br><br>Poorly formatted/incomplete data files are indeed an issue, one possibility to allow the user to 'confirm things are working' is to make examples available either in the distribution or we could possibly put some on the website.<br><br>Cheers,<br>Alun    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T13:17:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alun Ashton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;deeb78cf.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;e693c6f9.1412">   <title>Re: Open .fio files and "refresh/update" button </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;e693c6f9.1412</link>   <description> Hi,<br>just to close this issue:<br>DAWN is fine, but the .fio files that the user tested were somehow<br>inconsistent. Investigating on DESY side why that is the case...<br><br>But probably it would be good to make the file reader make the user aware<br>of such inconsistencies. I'll start a separate thread about this.<br><br>Cheers<br><br>Gero<br><br>On Thu, 11 Dec 2014, Gero Flucke wrote: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T13:50:38+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;e693c6f9.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;b1998cbe.1412">   <title>Re: Open .fio files and "refresh/update" button </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;b1998cbe.1412</link>   <description> Hi Jose,<br><br>&gt;<br>&gt; &gt; Another question is regarding the file update. For instance, when I<br>&gt; &gt; move any file to the activity folder that I'm working in DAWN the new<br>&gt; &gt; file doesn't automatically appear. I have to close and open again. Is<br>&gt; &gt; there any &quot;refresh&quot; or &quot;update&quot; button?<br><br>There's a refresh option in the context menu (right hand mouse click) which is bound to the F5 key. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T11:16:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;b1998cbe.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;f6737aad.1412">   <title>Re: Open .fio files and "refresh/update" button </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;f6737aad.1412</link>   <description> On Thu, 11 Dec 2014, Linares Mardegan, Jose Renato wrote:<br><br>&gt; This week I have installed DAWN software on my computer. However I'm<br>&gt; trying to work with &quot;.fio&quot; files but I can't open it. Is there anything<br>&gt; else I have to install? I've just installed the DAWN software. The<br>&gt; examples files included in the DAWN are working perfectly. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T11:24:45+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;f6737aad.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;6ad913a1.1412">   <title>Open .fio files and "refresh/update" button </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;6ad913a1.1412</link>   <description> Hi!<br><br>This week I have installed DAWN software on my computer. However I'm<br>trying to work with &quot;.fio&quot; files but I can't open it. Is there anything<br>else I have to install? I've just installed the DAWN software. The<br>examples files included in the DAWN are working perfectly.<br>Another question is regarding the file update. For instance, when I move<br>any file to the activity folder that I'm working in DAWN the new file<br>doesn't automatically appear. I have to close and open again. Is there<br>any &quot;refresh&quot; or &quot;update&quot; button? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T10:52:16+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linares Mardegan, Jose Renato</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;6ad913a1.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;d6a12406.1410">   <title>Re: Help running our own command server </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;d6a12406.1410</link>   <description> Hi Andrew,<br><br>Nice to make contact with you. We are currently looking at starting a collaboration with Oak Ridge National Laboratory - is this how you heard about DAWN or perhaps you have seen it presented at a conference? Can I ask if you are based in Vicksburg?<br><br>We would be happy to spend some time to help you get up and running. I wonder if you really need a command server or to be able to run the workflows in batch? There is a batch.sh/.bat file in the top level of the DAWN installation. This shows a command for [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-02T08:17:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;d6a12406.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;9b75bb83.1410">   <title>Help running our own command server </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;9b75bb83.1410</link>   <description> HI all,<br><br>We are evaluating Dawn for use in a scientific workflow project. Dawn has a lot of features we like \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd intuitive workflow we think technical but non-programmers could follow, python scripting, lots of visualization widgets/capabilities and eclipse implementation familiar to our clients who use \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdPhotron\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd for fortran development.<br>We would like to put together a demo \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd just a simple monte-carlo workflow (specify some data files, specify some variation of parameters, run some old school fortran, pack up results, look at them) but we need to run our own command server \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd at first on our desktops, then [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-01T19:33:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Strelzoff, Andrew ERDC-RDE-ITL-MS</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;9b75bb83.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;2ec4b390.1409">   <title>Re: Generate a nxs file for the arpes datat reduction </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;2ec4b390.1409</link>   <description> Hi Andrea,<br><br>&gt; If I understand correctly your file it contains a full fermi surface map of some metal, and there in stored under the analyser/data there are 40 spectras composed by 748 points in energy and 721 points in angle.<br><br>Just to let you know our correct in your understanding of the file. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-27T19:43:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Basham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;2ec4b390.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;d7a2149a.1409">   <title>Re: Generate a nxs file for the arpes datat reduction </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;d7a2149a.1409</link>   <description> First of all... THANKS!<br><br>I well received the file and it is significantly different from what I am<br>assembling.<br>If I understand correctly your file it contains a full fermi surface map of<br>some metal, and there in stored under the analyser/data there are 40<br>spectras composed by 748 points in energy and 721 points in angle.<br>Instead for now I am creating one nxs file from each of my txt spectras. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-22T17:34:15+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andrea Resta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;d7a2149a.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ee3678e4.1409">   <title>Re: Generate a nxs file for the arpes datat reduction </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ee3678e4.1409</link>   <description> Hi Andrea,<br>Thanks for your message. I don't think there is a script to convert the<br>Scienta analyzer data from txt to nexus. As requested, here's a link to<br>an example nexus file:<br>https://www.dropbox.com/s/cdchi1npbxa71e9/silverfake.nxs?dl=0<br>(will delete after 01.10.14)<br><br>If you use this to structure your file, you will (hopefully) be able to<br>run it through the ARPES Perspective. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-22T14:00:30+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Wharmby</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ee3678e4.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ffbad7e8.1409">   <title>Generate a nxs file for the arpes datat reduction </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ffbad7e8.1409</link>   <description> Good evening,<br><br>I am Andrea,<br>I write to this address hoping that is the correct to access the<br>information i need.<br><br>I am currently working on some ARPES data collected from a Scienta analyzer<br>and saved as txt.<br>Does exists already such routine/script?<br>I am generating a rudimentary hdf5 file from the txt using the hdf5 python<br>module. I can load the file into DAWN but it does not allow me to proceed<br>with the data reduction because its associates my files to the &quot;data<br>browsing&quot; Prospective.<br>Could you please tell me how is expected to be the file structure?<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-21T20:54:57+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andrea Resta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;ffbad7e8.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;8282c8e8.1407">   <title>Re: Questions on scisoft-hdf repository </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;8282c8e8.1407</link>   <description> Hi Johannes,<br><br>Did you consider simply cloning it on github? However, you should be aware that this code will be a third party dependency of the forthcoming dawnsci project in eclipse. I think at that point it will move to one of the eclipse hosting solutions.<br><br>Sincerely,<br><br>Matt<br><br>From: Johannes Rieke [mailto:johannes.rieke@GMAIL.COM]<br>Sent: 15 July 2014 15:04<br>To: DAWN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: [DAWN] Questions on scisoft-hdf repository [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-15T14:17:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;8282c8e8.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;7df75d51.1407">   <title>Questions on scisoft-hdf repository </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;7df75d51.1407</link>   <description> Hi everybody,<br><br>I am a member of the open source initiative OpenWorm (openworm.org) and am<br>currently working on a data format for neuroscience simulations, which is<br>based on HDF5. I came across your scisoft-hdf repository on Github (<br>https://github.com/DawnScience/scisoft-hdf/tree/master/ncsa.hdf). As we<br>would like to have something similar for a current version of HDF5, could<br>you give me some guidance on how you created that? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-15T16:03:30+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Johannes Rieke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;7df75d51.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;17ca3a4e.1405">   <title>Re: DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;17ca3a4e.1405</link>   <description> Hi Matt,<br><br>I am still on holiday, but this week I will try to send you the details<br>of my traveling. Sorry for the delay, hopefully it does not cause big<br>trouble.<br><br>Cheers,<br>G\ufffd\ufffdbor<br><br>On 2014-04-03 18:08, Matt.Gerring@DIAMOND.AC.UK wrote:<br>&gt; Hi folks,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Please find attached the final workshop schedule.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; To register please email me within the next 4 weeks and I will<br>&gt; arrange<br>&gt; for your site pass and meal tickets.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; If you need help with travel and hotels please email:<br>&gt; sarah.hartrampf@diamond.ac.uk [1] or me.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Best Regards,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Matt<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-07T16:11:17+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>G\ufffd\ufffdbor N\ufffd\ufffdray</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;17ca3a4e.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;a67d3061.1404">   <title>Re: DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;a67d3061.1404</link>   <description> Pleasure to have you.<br><br>From: Paul.gibbons@DIAMOND.AC.UK [mailto:Paul.gibbons@DIAMOND.AC.UK]<br>Sent: 04 April 2014 10:21<br>To: DAWN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: [DAWN] DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014<br><br>Hi Matt<br><br>Please book me on<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Paul Gibbons<br><br>Data Acquisition Group Leader<br>Diamond Light Source<br>www.diamond.ac.uk&lt;http://www.diamond.ac.uk&gt;<br><br>Tel +1235 778512<br><br>From: Matt.Gerring@DIAMOND.AC.UK&lt;mailto:Matt.Gerring@DIAMOND.AC.UK&gt; [mailto:Matt.Gerring@DIAMOND.AC.UK]<br>Sent: 03 April 2014 17:09<br>To: DAWN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&lt;mailto:DAWN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt;<br>Subject: Re: [DAWN] DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-04T09:29:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;a67d3061.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;c5a0b904.1404">   <title>Re: DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;c5a0b904.1404</link>   <description> Hi Matt<br><br>Please book me on<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Paul Gibbons<br><br>Data Acquisition Group Leader<br>Diamond Light Source<br>www.diamond.ac.uk&lt;http://www.diamond.ac.uk&gt;<br><br>Tel +1235 778512<br><br>From: Matt.Gerring@DIAMOND.AC.UK [mailto:Matt.Gerring@DIAMOND.AC.UK]<br>Sent: 03 April 2014 17:09<br>To: DAWN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: [DAWN] DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014<br><br>Hi folks,<br><br>Please find attached the final workshop schedule.<br><br>To register please email me within the next 4 weeks and I will arrange for your site pass and meal tickets. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-04T09:21:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;c5a0b904.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;4c3b2b3d.1404">   <title>Re: DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;4c3b2b3d.1404</link>   <description> Hi folks,<br><br>Please find attached the final workshop schedule.<br><br>To register please email me within the next 4 weeks and I will arrange for your site pass and meal tickets.<br><br>If you need help with travel and hotels please email: sarah.hartrampf@diamond.ac.uk&lt;mailto:sarah.hartrampf@diamond.ac.uk&gt; or me.<br><br>Best Regards,<br><br>Matt<br><br>From: Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Sent: 01 April 2014 14:34<br>To: DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK; DAWN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK; science-iwg@eclipse.org<br>Subject: DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-03T16:08:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;4c3b2b3d.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;6794e9c2.1404">   <title>DAWN Workshop 5th / 6th of June 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;6794e9c2.1404</link>   <description> Hi folks,<br><br>Hopefully you have all saved the 5th and/or 6th of June for the DAWN developers workshop? The planned agenda has an eclipse science working group day on the 5th because of the positive response - please let me know if you have changed your mind before I send around the agenda :) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-01T13:34:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN;6794e9c2.1404</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
